info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 4:04PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy snow in the western and central Mohawk valley, Schoharie Valley and western parts of the Capital Region and Lake George Saratoga Region... A band of heavy snow is drifting slowly east from extreme southeastern Hamilton County through parts of the central and western Mohawk Valley, Schoharie Valley, western parts of the Capital Region and Lake George Saratoga Region. This band of snow will slowly move east and northeast through 6 PM. The band will track through areas along and north of Albany through the Lake George Saratoga Region, reach the Rensselaer Plateau and southern Vermont by 6 PM. Visibilities will be less than a half mile with brief periods of near zero visibility. Snowfall rates will be 1 to 3 inches per hour. Motorists are advised to slow down and allow for extra distance between yourself and other drivers.
